column11:
This table summarizes the Fall 2023 Student Credit Hours (SCH) and Full-Time Equivalent (FTE) enrollments at CCSU, by school. It shows the teaching activity split between undergraduate and graduate levels, includes “graduate extra credit” weighting, and converts totals into FTE counts.

By School (Fall 2023):

Liberal Arts & Social Sciences – the largest unit, with 50,577 total credit hours and about 3,241 FTEs.

Business – generated 13,624 credit hours, equating to 794 FTEs.

Education – contributed 5,451 credit hours, resulting in 162 FTEs.

Health & Rehabilitation Sciences – produced 9,036 credit hours for 479 FTEs.

Engineering, Science & Technology – second-largest load, with 34,891 credit hours and 2,110 FTEs.

Column meanings:

Undergrad / Graduate Credit Hours – total hours of instruction at each level.

Graduate Extra Credit – added weight for graduate instruction.

Grand Total Credit Hours – overall credit count after adjustments.

FTE Undergrad / Graduate / Total – enrollment equivalents standardized (UG SCH ÷ 15, GR SCH ÷ 12).
